task.title: Configuring the TCP Receive Window
task.shortdesc: How to configure the TCP receive window.

prereq.p: Before you start, you must understand the following:

step.cmd: To configure the TCP receive window.

info.p: The CTCPReceiveWindowSize() class defines the public interface that the Licensee's NetMcpr must use to configure the TCP receive window.

step.cmd: To set the receive window for different bearers.
step.info: Licensees need to override the SetTcpWin() function to set the TCP receive window for different bearers.

step.cmd: Use the SetTCPwin() function to set the TCP receive window size.

substep.cmd: To configure the Max TCP receive window size per TCP socket
substep.info: If licensees want to configure the Max TCP receive window size per TCP socket, then they must specify a value greater than the Max value configured in the tcpip.ini file.

substep.cmd: To set the TCP receive Max value uniform across all sockets
substep.info: If licensees want to set the TCP receive Max value uniform across all sockets, then they must specify the value in the tcpip.ini file and set the iMaxWinSize = 0. So, MaxWinSize is always configured from the tcpip.ini file.

step.cmd: Use the AppendExtensionL() function to add the pointer to the lookup table.
step.info: The lookup table holds the TCP receive window size for different bearer types.
